strings.heading: Cell Wall
strings.description: Cell wall is a rigid, outermost layer composed primarily of cellulose, providing structural support, protection, and maintaining the cell's shape.

strings.heading: Nucleus
strings.description: A double-membrane structure that encloses the nucleus and separates the genetic material (DNA) from the cytoplasm

strings.heading: Large Central Vacuole
strings.description: A prominent, membrane-bound organelle that stores water, nutrients, and waste products

strings.heading: Cytoplasm
strings.description: A gel-like, semi-fluid substance that fills the space between the cell membrane and the nucleus, containing all the organelles and structures necessary for the cell's function
